elements.title: Goetsch–Winckler House
elements.contents: ... that the Frank Lloyd Wright Building Conservancy bought the Goetsch–Winckler House (pictured) just two days before it was to be auctioned off?

elements.title: Soumen Mitra
elements.contents: ... that Soumen Mitra helped restore a building which had housed one of India's first mental asylums?

elements.title: Wanderstop
elements.contents: ... that cozy game Wanderstop took so long to develop, according to director Davey Wreden, that "cozy game" became a swear word?

elements.title: Yvette Greer-Albrecht
elements.contents: ... that Yvette Greer-Albrecht was named as the Female College Athlete of the Year by the South Dakota Sportswriters Association in 1979?

elements.title: Fred Borak
elements.contents: ... that NFL player Fred Borak once played basketball against the Harlem Globetrotters?

elements.title: night
elements.contents: ... that one night on the planet Venus lasts just over 58 full days on Earth?

elements.title: Samar Abu Elouf
elements.contents: ... that photojournalist Samar Abu Elouf once improvised protective gear from a cooking pot while documenting a protest?

elements.title: fear and trembling
elements.contents: ... that the scriptural phrase "fear and trembling" has been used to celebrate hospitality, explore the nature of faith, and justify slavery?

elements.title: flower
elements.contents: ... that a sunflower is not a flower?
